title: Brighton 1-2 Newcastle: Perez and Diame strike as Toon fight back late on - 5 things we learned
text:
Ayoze Perez of Newcastle United celebrates with team mates (Photo: Getty Images Europe) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Newcastle fought back to take all three points in their dramatic top-of-the-table clash with Brighton. 
The Magpies looked to be heading for defeat until late goals from Mo Diame and substitute Ayoze Perez. 
Glenn Murray opened the scoring from the penalty spot after referee Bobby Madley penalised Ciaran Clark. 
The Magpies drew level as Diame diverted a wayward shot over the stranded David Stockdale before Perez turned home Christian Atsu's cross. 
Here are five things we learned. 1. Rafa redeems himself after getting it wrong Rafael Benitez looks on (Photo: Getty Images Europe) 
Rafa Benitez made a surprising selection as he opted to go with no recognised strikers at the Amex. 
With main frontman Dwight Gayle out injured, the Spaniard opted to leave Ayoze Perez, Daryl Murphy and Aleksandar Mitrovic on the bench. 
Yoan Gouffran was tasked with leading the line and worked tirelessly but he's better suited to a deeper role. 
The visitors dominated the ball throughout the first-half but the absence of an out-and-out striker was clear. 
It was no surprise the game changed when Benitez threw on Murphy and Perez. 2. Madley's big call Brighton & Hove Albion's Glenn Murray scores (Photo: PA) 
Bobby Madley made the headlines before this one, given his apparent allegiance to Huddersfield - who are vying with these two for promotion. 
He will have been hoping for a quiet night but made a big call early on. 
The referee awarded the hosts a penalty after Ciaran Clark hauled Glenn Murray to the deck. 
Replays showed it was six of one and half a dozen of the other - but defenders have been warned against shirt pulling in the box. 
Murray dusted himself down to score from the spot, leaving Benitez furious. 3. Lady luck smiles on Toon Newcastle United's Jonjo Shelvey (Photo: Getty) 
Newcastle won't have been happy about the opener - but luck was certainly on their side as they drew level. 
After a couple of fluffed shots, the ball ricocheted off Mo Diame and looped into the net. 
The Senegalese midfielder had done next to nothing before that but it was a massive moment for the visitors. 
As flukey as it was important, mind. 4. SAS make Seagulls tick Dale Stephens in action (Photo: The Chronicle) 
Neither are the most dynamic of midfielders but Steve Sidwell and Dale Stephens are vital to this Brighton side. 
They win the ball, keep it simple and allow the flair players in front of them to do their thing. 
At 34, Sidwell is the veteran of the partnership but he still has plenty to offer. Brighton & Hove Albion's Steve Sidwell (Photo: Getty) 
Stephens meanwhile, was heavily linked with Burnley in the summer but Brighton managed to keep hold of him. 
If the Seagulls are to go up, Chris Hughton will need his midfield pairing to stay fit. 5. Promotion on the cards for both Rafael Benitez and Chris Hughton (Photo: PA) 
It was no surprise to see the top two in the division play out a cracker. 
These two have been up there all season and despite tonight's result, both should go up this season. 
This was the first of three huge away games for Benitez's men with Huddersfield and Reading to come in the next week. 
The Magpies picked up a vital win here and will go into those games full of confidence.
